name: app-login
description: It provides server login and signup functionality. It remembers login for 24hrs at server end. All passwords and tokens are encrypted, so that the session is secured.
author: aayush.nitb@gmail.com

model: Optional json path wrt app root, to specify db details.

server: Name of server where db is hosted.
collection: Name of collection where user objects should be stored.

methods.login(user, password): This will open a user session at server end for 24 hrs.
methods.authorize(success, failure, binding): All client side user-specific functions must go through this function. If the user is logged-in, then success(binding) is called else failure(binding) is called. You may skip these args if corresponding methods are already registered via registerSuccess(callback) and registerFailure(callback) methods.
methods.logout(): This will close the user session at server end.
methods.getAuth(): Returns the auth token of current logged-in user. All user-specific rest calls must include this token for authentication at server end.
methods.registerSuccess(callback): This will register a success callback for authorize method, so that success arg can be skipped while calling authorize method.
methods.registerFailure(callback): This will register a failure callback for authorize method, so that failure arg can be skipped while calling authorize method.

services.name: login.coffee
services.description: Include this file in your service handler to get authentication methods.

methods.auth(req, res, next): This is a middleware method for node express module. The next callback is called only when basic auth is matched against the db.
methods.user(): Returns the username of current logged-in user.
